verb.description: Be constantly or visibly worried or anxious.
examples: she fretted about the cost of groceries
I fretted that my fingers were so skinny

verb.description: Gradually wear away (something) by rubbing or gnawing.
examples: the bay's black waves fret the seafront

verb.description: Flow or move in small waves.
examples: soft clay that fretted between his toes

noun.description: A state of anxiety or worry.
